intro: Centaurea scorpiurifolia, commonly known as the scorpius leaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive blue or grayish hue, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Centaurea scorpiurifolia is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
